Content: give sample "Hello World!" solutions in as many different programming languages as you can think of

Here are "Hello World!" solutions in various programming languages:

## C
```c
#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
    printf("Hello World!\n");
    return 0;
}
```

## C++
```cpp
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int main() {
    cout << "Hello World!" << endl;
    return 0;
}
```

## Java
```java
public class HelloWorld {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello World!");
    }
}
```

## Python
```python
print("Hello World!")
```

## JavaScript
```javascript
console.log("Hello World!");
```

## HTML + JavaScript
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>
    <script>
        document.write("Hello World!");
    </script>
</body>
</html>
```

## Ruby
```ruby
puts "Hello World!"
```

## PHP
```php
<?php
echo "Hello World!";
?>
```

## Go
```go
package main
import "fmt"

func main() {
    fmt.Println("Hello World!")
}
```

## Rust
```rust
fn main() {
    println!("Hello World!");
}
```

## Swift
```swift
print("Hello World!")
```

## Kotlin
```kotlin
fun main() {
    println("Hello World!")
}
```

## C#
```csharp
using System;

class Program {
    static void Main() {
        Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");
    }
}
```

## Objective-C
```objc
#import <Foundation/Foundation.h>

int main() {
    NSLog(@"Hello World!");
    return 0;
}
```

## R
```r
print("Hello World!")
```

## MATLAB
```matlab
disp('Hello World!')
```

## Perl
```perl
print "Hello World!\n";
```

## Bash
```bash
echo "Hello World!"
```

## Scala
```scala
object HelloWorld {
    def main(args: Array[String]): Unit = {
        println("Hello World!")
    }
}
```

## Haskell
```haskell
main = putStrLn "Hello World!"
```

## Lua
```lua
print("Hello World!")
```

## Pascal
```pascal
program HelloWorld;
begin
    writeln('Hello World!');
end.
```

## Fortran
```fortran
program HelloWorld
    implicit none
    print *, 'Hello World!'
end program HelloWorld
```

## Assembly (x86-64 Linux)
```assembly
section .data
    msg db "Hello World!", 10, 0
    msg_len equ $ - msg

section .text
    global _start

_start:
    mov rax, 1
    mov rdi, 1
    mov rsi, msg
    mov rdx, msg_len
    syscall

    mov rax, 60
    mov rdi, 0
    syscall
```

## Dart
```dart
void main() {
    print('Hello World!');
}
```

## Elixir
```elixir
IO.puts "Hello World!"
```

## Groovy
```groovy
println "Hello World!"
```

## Julia
```julia
println("Hello World!")
```

## OCaml
```ocaml
print_endline "Hello World!"
```

## Scheme
```scheme
(display "Hello World!")
(newline)
```

## Smalltalk
```smalltalk
Transcript show: 'Hello World!'; cr.
```

## Visual Basic .NET
```vb
Module HelloWorld
    Sub Main()
        Console.WriteLine("Hello World!")
    End Sub
End Module
```

## Tcl
```tcl
puts "Hello World!"
```

## CoffeeScript
```coffeescript
console.log "Hello World!"
```

## D
```d
import std.stdio;

void main() {
    writeln("Hello World!");
}
```

## Nim
```nim
echo "Hello World!"
```

## Crystal
```crystal
puts "Hello World!"
```

## Zig
```zig
const std = @import("std");

pub fn main() void {
    std.debug.print("Hello World!\n", .{});
}
```

## Ada
```ada
procedure Hello_World is
begin
    Put_Line("Hello World!");
end Hello_World;
```

## PL/SQL
```sql
BEGIN
    DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Hello World!');
END;
```

## Racket
```racket
#lang racket
(displayln "Hello World!")
```

## Clojure
```clojure
(println "Hello World!")
```

This covers a wide variety of programming paradigms and languages, from low-level systems programming to high-level scripting languages!
